about.summary: Fabric is a simple, Pythonic tool for remote execution and deployment.

name: fabric
raw_recipe:
{%set name = "Fabric" %}
{%set version = "1.12.0" %}
{%set compress_type = "tar.gz" %}
{%set hash_type = "sha256" %}
{%set hash_val = "fafa17d69a15fd6ae5f82d28acbf90e1bf15e3d7438fbf0e8691868164c0e9dc" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.{{ compress_type }}
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.{{ compress_type }}
  {{ hash_type }}: {{ hash_val }}

build:
  skip: True  # [py3k]
  entry_points:
    - fab = fabric.main:main
  number: 0
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record=record.txt

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - setuptools

  run:
    - python
    - paramiko >=1.10,<2.0

test:
  imports:
    - fabric
    - fabric.contrib

  commands:
    - fab --help

about:
  home: http://fabfile.org
  license: BSD 2-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Fabric is a simple, Pythonic tool for remote execution and deployment.'
  dev_url: https://github.com/fabric/fabric/
  doc_url: http://docs.fabfile.org/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - pmlandwehr
